Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2015 01:54PM ORknitter wrote: Funny story about not shaving, I was sitting outside with our youngest daughter (25) who started laughing hysterically. When I finally asked her what was so funny she said "Your arm pit hair is blowing in the wind!" It's been 8 weeks and I still don't have hair where the rads hit.
Posts.Title: Deodorant Nancdancer SOuwant2fite

Posts.Content: ORknitter wrote: I'm on exesmestane (3 months) and have only had some minor aches, but yesterday I had a little fall, slipped on a slimy step landing on my backside. Today I feel sore all over with a bruise where I landed, even the breast where I had a lumpectomy is achy. Anyone have any thoughts? I've fallen before in my life & not felt as sore. Dx 4/2015, DCIS, Left, 2cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Surgery 5/20/2015 Lumpectomy: Left Radiation Therapy 7/3/2015 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy Aromasin (exemestane) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain after a "fall" ORknitter ORknitter

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2016 07:56PM ORknitter wrote: Joy, I had almost constant, annoying pain from the biopsy and wire site (same place). I was sent to PT which helped a lot, she used something that looks like a shoehorn just gently massaging it and the pain was gone. I went back 1 more time and didn't notice any difference so that was it for me. Now it's sore again but I can easily live with it.
